meanings.definition: Stubbornness or refusal to change one's opinion or course of action.
meanings.sent1: Her obduracy in sticking to her decision surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher tried to reason with the student, but his obduracy was evident.
meanings.sent3: Despite the rain, his obduracy about having a picnic never wavered.
meanings.sent4: The obduracy of the old tree's roots made it impossible to uproot.
meanings.sent5: The obduracy of the lock finally gave way to the determined locksmith.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unyielding or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: The obduracy of the rock made it impossible to break.
meanings.sent2: His obduracy in following the rules sometimes caused conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The obduracy of the frozen ice cream surprised the kids.
meanings.sent4: The obduracy of the steel beam withstood the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The obduracy of the old bridge stood the test of time.
